posts.author: Elysion
posts.content:
I would like to introduce you guys to a build Idea that I think would be fun to play in a PvM environment. If someone knows an optimized build for this please let me know.

The Idea behind this build would be to have a shapeshifting singing dragon Monk.
My original thinking about the level distribution would be: 18th level druid (for dragon shape), 16th level Bard (optimal bardic song) and 6th Level Monk (gaining (Improved) Knockdown)
I need help with optimizing this build for level progression form level 1 to 40. Which feats/skills to pick first? which class to pick at what level? How and when to do the alignment shifting? etc.
It's probably a challenge to find the optimal build for this and to play it, but that's what makes it fun to me after having played the game multiple times in the past.

1) PvM or PvP - This is mainly a PvM build for fun

2) Level cap - level cap 40

3) Race preference - Probably human for multiclassing

4) Class preference - 18 Druid, 16 Bard, 6 Monk

5) Melee preference - Unarmed attack

6) Range preference - Zen Archery (WIS)

7) Weapon preference - doesn't matter

8) Maximum item enhancement - +10

9) Spellcasting - Original thinking was to use buffing spells, but I am open for suggestions

10) Custom factors - no custom factors

Thanks for anyone willing to brainstorm on this build 😜

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Elysion - and welcome to the Guild!

Before someone who knows something about druids comes along, it might be worth pointing out that with no custom factors, you can't be both a monk and a bard. Monk has to be lawful alignment, while bard has to be anything except lawful. (I think druids have to have some neutral in them.) So it might be worth thinking which you prefer.

Sorry to be a pain.

posts.author: Elysion
posts.content: Hey Stagmeister, Thanks for the welcome and the response and yes I know the alignments will be a tricky part in this build and it will require some alignment shifting during gameplay. I see that as part of the challenge/lore of the build. I have played NWN and NWN2 multiple times in the past and I am looking for a bit of a challenge.(made an edit to the original post to include the alignment shifts)
